page.title: 06Etonbury Middle School
page.content: Etonbury school was built in 1953 as a secondary school.It was called Etonbury because of the Anglo-Saxon earthworks of the same name nearby. It was opened in 1955 but not completed until 1958.An exposed yet prominent site between Arlesey and Stotfold was chosen for the school which draws its pupils from these two villages. The school became a Middle School for children between the ages of 9 to 13 when Bedfordshire reorganised its schools into comprehensives in 1975. The number of children who attend the school now number approximately 440 and there are 20 teachers employed there.
